meanings.definition: People or things that cement or bind together.
meanings.sent1: The cementers in the group were the ones who always brought everyone together.
meanings.sent2: The team captain was known as the cementers of the team, keeping everyone united.
meanings.sent3: The family reunion was a success thanks to the cementers who organized fun activities for everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words acted as the cementers, strengthening the friendship between the two neighbors.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the magical necklace served as the cementers, bringing peace to the warring kingdoms.

meanings.definition: Those who solidify or strengthen a relationship or bond.
meanings.sent1: Grandparents are often seen as the cementers of family relationships, keeping everyone close.
meanings.sent2: The best friends acted as the cementers in their group, always supporting each other.
meanings.sent3: The wise old owl was jokingly called the cementers of the forest, as it brought all animals together for advice.
meanings.sent4: Their shared love for music was the cementers that bound their friendship for years.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance acted as the cementers, helping the apprentice grow stronger in their craft.

meanings.definition: Materials or substances used to make concrete or mortar.
meanings.sent1: The workers unloaded bags of cementers to start building the new house.
meanings.sent2: The construction site was filled with various cementers needed for the project.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the sand on the beach was magical cementers for their sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins revealed the remnants of the cementers used by the civilization long ago.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor carefully mixed the cementers to create a strong base for the statue.
